title: Annie is the definition of an unhealthy champion
body: Annie is the perfect example of a champion who needs a rework or at least minor tweaks. Her ability to 100-0 people whitout being fed and only having one item and this one shotting also including being stunned for the entire time and also the fact that she has 0 skillshots and a complete lack of anything resembling counterplay apart from camping her lane from lvl1 till lvl18. It baffles me why riot has refused to rework gher even though she is the perfect example of an unhealthy champion.

replies.body:
{{champion:79}} is the definition of an unhealthy champion

fucken drinks too much alcohol, needs to go into rehab

Lack of counter play?

Annie, meet xerath.
wait, or you saying xerath has no counterplay?

Hell no! Xerath gets ruined by many champs (those with strong gap closers in particular ) but xerath range makes life very hard for Annie.  In my league at least I seldom lose to an annie when playing xer. Never say never, but xeraths offensive  range gives immediate advantage over annie.

While I do agree with the sentiment (that Annie needs a rework), you don't need skillshots for a champion to require skill. In fact, it's boring when too many champions have skillshots.

An example of a reasonably healthy champion (that may need slight tweaks but overall doesn't need a rework) is Master Yi. Master Yi has 0 skillshots, but he still requires a good level of skill to play, especially against players that aren't bad. His Q dodge requires an excellent sense of timing, choosing the time to fight is also critical (his short range makes him easy to blow up) and he has a lot of hidden depth that lower Elo players fail to see.

The reason Annie needs a rework is simple - the instant stuns on her W and ult. Flash ult has barely any counterplay (besides prediction/staying clear of her flash+ult range).

If I were Riot, I'd make the bear's autoattacks stun people and remove her passive stun. Obviously it'd be OP if every AA stunned so it could have some small delay like Udyr E.

For the last bit, wouldn't that destroy Annie's support potential and kill a lot of threat from her laning phase? She is only strong due to high scaling and the ability to zone you with her stun up, which shut down a lot of lethal combo's to her immobile kit

Perhaps, to be honest I was just throwing something out there without thinking too hard about it. They could maybe get away with a shorter stun (e.g. 0.5 seconds). Or maybe they could keep the current stun length and add delay to her ult by making her "throw" the bear, giving the enemy time to react. The W stun could still be instant since it's ~250 shorter range.
I think all she needs are longer cooldowns, maybe lower base damage.

she is literally an assassin that was supposed to be a mage they need to do an over haul like they did to ahri and change her from an assassin mage to a mage or a kite mage (which is what her stun was meant to be for)
I have been saying this for about 9 decades, Annie is the most broken champion in this game. Followed by Riven.
she has 2 skillshots, that you should probably not be in range for without a need for her flash.
Short range. squishy, immobile, has an indicator when her stun is up, usually requires flash for tibbers initiate unless you're standing by her then you're doing it wrong.

The indicator is irrelevant if you're against a competent Annie. A good Annie will keep her stun on 3 stacks and use her E at the same time as another ability. The best Annies can even do it on 2 stacks with a flash E-W-ult before you have time to react.
